top_categories.workout_context: Trans-Sylvania Epic’s 225-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Trans-Sylvania Epic’s pa mountains, multi-stage demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Trans-Sylvania Epic when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Trans-Sylvania Epic rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Trans-Sylvania Epic isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
At 225 miles, Trans-Sylvania Epic rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Trans-Sylvania Epic’s 15,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Every session at Trans-Sylvania Epic intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Trans-Sylvania Epic’s pa mountain gravel delivers on race day.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Trans-Sylvania Epic. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Trans-Sylvania Epic — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Trans-Sylvania Epic’s pa mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 225 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 225 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Trans-Sylvania Epic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on pa mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: pa mountains, multi-stage, regional event.
